definition: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (CCDI), organization within the CCP which investigates corruption and other wrongdoing among Party cadres/abbr. for 中共中央紀律檢查委員會|中共中央纪律检查委员会
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly
Organization Department/abbr. for 中共中央組織部|中共中央组织部[Zhong1 Gong4 Zhong1 yang1 Zu3 zhi1 bu4]
shuanggui, an extralegal system within the CCP for detaining and interrogating cadres who fall from grace
Zhou Yongkang (1942-), PRC petroleum engineer and politician
Bo Xilai (1949-), PRC politician, appointed to the Politburo in 2007, sentenced in 2013 to life imprisonment for corruption and misconduct
secretary (chief official of a branch of a socialist or communist party)/clerk/scribe
